facts.text: Septimius Severus is proclaimed Roman Emperor by the army in Illyricum (in the Balkans).
Byzantine Emperor Basiliscus issues a circular letter (Enkyklikon) to the bishops of his empire, supporting the Monophysite christological position.
Constantine ends his reign as Catholic Pope
Battle of Liegnitz - Mongol armies defeat Poles & Germans
Battle of NÃ¤fels; Glarius Swiss defeat Habsburg (Austrian) army
Henry V is crowned King of England.
Christopher of Bavaria is appointed King of Denmark.
Milan and Venice sign peace of Lodi
Breisach land guardian Peter von Hagenbach throws out Walloon/Italians

Edward V (aged 12) succeeds his father Edward IV as king of England. He was never crowned, and disappeared, presumed murdered, after incarceration in the Tower of London with his younger brother Richard (the "Princes in the Tower")
Danish king Christian III enters Schmalkaldische Union
Marcello Cervini elected Pope Marcellus II
Spain & Netherlands sign 12 Year Resistant Pact
